heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) when compared to today.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 789m to 2540m and averaged 1404.2m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, humidity should not be a concern and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (90%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
